title: Wikimedia Tool
description: A tool is a piece of software that helps facilitate contribution toward, or consumption of, Wikimedia projects and associated data, not including the core wiki software and its extensions

name.description: Unique identifier for tools. Must be unique for every tool. It is recommended you prefix your tool names to reduce the risk of clashes.

title.description: Human readable tool name. Recommended limit of 25 characters.

subtitle.description: Longer than the full title but shorter than the description. It should add some additional context to the title.

openhub_id.description: The project ID on OpenHub. Given a URL https://openhub.net/p/foo, the project ID is `foo`.

description.description: A longer description of the tool. The recommended length for a description is 3-5 sentences. Future versions of this schema will impose a character limit.

url.description: A direct link to the tool or to instructions on how to use or install the tool.

keywords.@commment: Comma-delineated list of keywords. This parameter is deprecated and will be removed in the next version.

repository.description: A link to the repository where the tool code is hosted.

bot_username.description: If the tool is a bot, the Wikimedia username of the bot. Do not include 'User:' or similar prefixes.

deprecated.description: If true, the use of this tool is officially discouraged. The `replaced_by` parameter can be used to define a replacement.

replaced_by.description: If this tool is deprecated, this parameter should be used to link to the replacement tool.

experimental.description: If true, this tool is unstable and can change or go offline at any time.

for_wikis.description: A string or array of strings describing the wiki(s) this tool can be used on. Use hostnames such as `zh.wiktionary.org`. Use asterisks as wildcards. For example, `*.wikisource.org` means 'this tool works on all Wikisource wikis.' `*` means 'this works on all wikis, including Wikimedia wikis.'

icon.description: A link to a Wikimedia Commons file description page for an icon that depicts the tool.

license.description: The software license the tool code's is available under. Use a standard SPDX license keyword.

sponsor.description: Organization that sponsored the tool's development.

available_ui_languages.description: The language(s) the tool's interface has been translated into. Specify this field manually only if the tool does not handle interface translation through translatewiki.net. Use ISO 639 language codes like `zh` and `scn`. If not defined it is assumed the tool is only available in English.

technology_used.description: A string or array of strings listing technologies (programming languages, development frameworks, etc.) used in creating the tool.

tool_type.description: The manner in which the tool is used. Select one from the list of options.

api_url.description: A link to the tool's API, if available.

developer_docs_url.description: A link to the tool's developer documentation, if available.

feedback_url.description: A link to where tool users can leave feedback.

privacy_policy_url.description: A link to the tool's privacy policy, if available.

translate_url.description: A link to the tool translation interface.

bugtracker_url.description: A link to the tool's bug tracker on GitHub, Bitbucket, Phabricator, etc.

toolinfo_version.description: The major version number of the Toolinfo schema used. The default value assumed is 1, referring to versions 1.0.0 and 1.1.0.

toolinfo_language.description: The language the toolinfo record is written if, if not the default value of English. Use ISO 639 language codes.
